column1: #Do not remove, modify or reorder the line below
# * Lines beginning with # or " are comments and will be ignored
# * Starting with row 20, one line equals one created network
# * Columns D through N are used to define manual subnet overrides
# * The last column contains an optional space-separated list of serial numbers to be claimed into the network
# * In cells D19 through N19, replace X with the number of the VLAN you want to manually override the subnet of. Any columns left as VLAN X will be ignored
# * If needed, you can add more VLAN columns before the serial numbers' column
# * The "Street address" cell directs the script to reset physical location information for any claimed devices to this value. Leave blank to skip
# * Enter site info as shown in the example row. Define subnet overrides as the network IP address with no mask or prefix. Leave cells blank to skip
# * Export file as a CSV. Either use "," or ";" as a delimeter (but not both).  Use the CSV as an input file to run provision_sites.py

column15: Device serial numbers to claim into network, separated by spaces

column1: Example Net (modify or delete this row)
